items.content:
*About us:*
Squirrel is a simple app that changes people’s lives for the better – by managing their money for them. Instead of getting paid into a bank account, Squirrel users get paid into Squirrel! The app then saves and budgets for them. Paying money into their bank account just before they need it – for bills, weekly spending, and when they finish saving up for something.

It’s rare for ideas to be good for the world, unique, profitable, and be fun and challenging to work on – but Squirrel is all of these things!

*What we’re looking for:*
* A Full Stack Senior level developer to build the next generation Open Banking version of Squirrel.
* Ambitious Python Backend Engineer Wanting to Grow Into CTO
* 5+ Years Exerience
* Interest in working with open banking API’s
* Keen to grow into architecting a new product & coding, as well as learning to lead.

We’re all passionate and interested in making a sustainably great business, and ideally you’ll be the same – We’d love to meet someone able to communicate and work across the team on various topics (from tech to UX, to product) to refine requirements, prioritise and deploy.

*Location*
Ideally you’ll be London based, but we’re willing to consider remote workers in other parts of the UK (with occasional travel to the London office).

items.title: ShipHero: Senior Python Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=48, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=4, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Python Developer

We are ShipHero (https://shiphero.com). We have built a software platform entrusted by hundreds of ecommerce companies, large and small to run their operations. Many of our customers sell on Shopify and/or Amazon. We’re driven to help our customers grow their businesses, by providing a platform that solves complex problems, and is engineered to be reliable and fast. We are obsessed with building great technology, that is beautiful and easy to use. Our culture also reflects our ethos and belief that by bringing passionate, talented and great people together - you can do great things.

Our team is remote, with most of our engineers right now are either in New York, Argentina and Colombia. 

We are seeking a senior software engineer with proven programming and analytic abilities. You would be a fundamental member of the team focusing on building a solid foundation for the platform. We seek people who are excited and driven to grow with the experience of working with talented engineers. We are obsessed with disrupting an industry that desperately needs it, by continuing to build tools that help make our customers do great things.
You will work on our integrations with ecommerce platforms such as Shopify, Amazon, eBay and Etsy. The integrations are used at scale.

We are hiring engineers in American timezones only for right now.

About You

- You understand that great things are accomplished when teams work together.

- You’ve got lots of experience with Python, SQLAlchemy, FLASK and ideally GraphQL.

- You have some AWS experience.

- You can code review other team members work and provide assistance and appreciate feedback.

- You take pride in your craft.

- You’ve learned from building systems and solutions the reasons to avoid technical debt, and how to approach and implement TDD and CI practices.

- You can craft elegant solutions when solving complex features and solutions.

- You want to build something that is disrupting an entire industry.

- While hands on experience is not a requirement, you’re interested in learning how to apply machine learning and AI technologies and tools.

- You can handle a fast paced environment.

- You’ve made a lot of mistakes, and most importantly, have learned from them.

- You have 7+ years of experience developing software.

- You have worked remotely before.

The Role

- Work on a cross-functional team including front end and UX to build solutions that are easy for customers to understand, work consistently and scale well.

- Review features and requirements and guide, design and implement solutions.

- Understand business requirements and think through solutions in terms of not just the coding implementation but also how the solution fits into the solution and how it solves a customer need.

- Ability to estimate effort and ship on agreed schedule. Comfortable pushing yourself and your team members when challenges pop up.

- Lead regular code reviews, with the goal of code quality, good design and approach along with pushing engineers to improve and evolve.

- Optimize existing tech stack and solutions, determine path to next step in the evolution.

- Learn, and push those around you to do the same - this is a craft that you’re constantly improving upon.

- Implement solutions that are pragmatic to get the platform built.

- Have the confidence to work with experienced and talented people to just build great things, you’re not a “rockstar”.

- Work with ShipHero leadership to implement practices and principles for the team.

items.title: REMOTE CTO
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=30, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=18}
items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, Celery, RabbitMQ, Angular.js, AWS, Startup Experience, JavaScript

If you are a CTO with experience, please read on!

Home care is a rapidly growing $72 billion dollar industry in the United States serving over 1.5 million people. Home care is supported by some of the most powerful macro factors affecting the global economy: (1) the largest demographic shift in human history; (2) a shift in the $3 trillion dollar healthcare industry from fee-for-service to value-based care, which has expanded reimbursement for home care services; and (3) advancements in telehealth which enable the shift of healthcare from traditional clinical environments to the home.

Of the over 18 million seniors currently needing home care, 6 million receive care from family members and 1.5 million receive care through home care agencies. Our aging population drives the growth of the home care industry, with 10,000 people turning 65 every day. On top of this core growth, health insurers and other payers are increasingly reimbursing for home care, thus driving an increase in the percentage of seniors that can afford home care and driving an increase from the 1.5 million who receive home care today into the 18 million seniors that need home care in order to stay independent and age-in-place. Over 90% of seniors want to age-in-place: not only is it the most desired outcome, but it is also the most cost-effective.

Despite tremendous growth, the home care industry, along with the seniors and families it serves, faces numerous challenges. Agencies struggle to efficiently operate amidst complex logistics and regulatory pressures: dozens or hundreds of caregivers operate remotely in the homes of seniors during one of the most difficult periods in life, with limited oversight and delayed visibility to family members into the daily care provided in the home.

Family members suffer from acute pain points associated with the demands of managing a loved one with a deteriorating health condition, often compounded by having to do so from afar. Problems of monitoring the day-to-day care and well-being of a loved one, managing medications, and coordinating with providers and other family members are particularly acute.

For healthcare constituents (providers, payers, and pharmaceutical companies), the patients served by home care agencies are typically among the highest cost and highest utilization, and are characterized by having multiple chronic conditions and functional limitations. Home care today is largely decoupled from the traditional healthcare ecosystem. If healthcare constituents could drive in-home interventions via the home care industry, billions of dollars could be saved each year while simultaneously improving healthcare and aging for millions of people.

Over the past two years, our company has emerged as the market leader serving 8 of the 10 largest home care enterprises and over 4,000 home care agencies nationwide. We power over 250 million hours of care per year, acting effectively as the virtual nervous system for the last mile of care for the world's
costliest patient population: that is, seniors with multiple chronic conditions and functional limitations.

By virtue of our market leadership and ongoing cadence of innovation, we are rapidly emerging as the system of record for the home care industry. Our new platform sales motion continues to accelerate, and our growth is further buoyed by upsells, which now achieve more than 60% attachment on new accounts.

While the revenue model today is powered by B2B sales to home care agencies, our company's web-based platform solves problems for all of the parties involved in the care of seniors: family members, caregivers, seniors and the broader healthcare community.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

WORK REMOTELY

What You Will Be Doing

Build and design a scalable technology stack
Approach challenges proactively
Design and utilize third-party APIs to core systems and healthcare institutions
Effectively communicate technical solutions and roadmap to leadership
Triage and fix bugs in code
Effectively QA and test code
Ability to build and strengthen a team of developers (employees and freelancers)

What You Need for this Position

Entrepreneurial mindset required
Prior experience building an application from scratch
Prior Start-up Experience Required
Extensive Python/Django experience
Full-stack experience (will be working on both front and back end)
Balanced ego- able to take ownership and action while collaborating and receiving direction
Excellent creative problem solver- able to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem
Strong deductive reasoning- able to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense
Prior experience in Healthcare or Elderly services is a plus
Machine Learning skills is a plus

- Python
- Django
- PostgreSQL
- Redis
- Celery
- RabbitMQ
- Angular.js
- AWS
- Startup Experience
- JavaScript

What's In It for You

-Base Salary
- Vacation/PTO
- Medical
- Dental
- Vision
- Bonus
- 401k
- Equity ShareSo, if you are a CTO with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

Security Clearance will be needed - therefore, only US citizens can be considered.Please apply directly to by clicking 'Click Here to Apply' with your Word resume!

Looking forward to receiving your resume and going over the position in more detail with you.

- Not a fit for this position? Click the link at the bottom of this email to search all of our open positions.

Looking forward to receiving your resume!

CyberCoders

CyberCoders, Inc is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Your Right to Work - In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

items.content:
Senior Python Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Advertising, B2B, Data & Analytics
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: VC Funded
Company: Backtracks | Austin, TX

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-06:00) Central Time +/- 6 hours
Office Location: Austin, TX. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

python
elasticsearch
flask
rabbitmq
docker

Job description

Build delightful software for podcasts and spoken word audio. Backtracks is seeking a qualified Senior Python Developer with some PEP to join our Product & Engineering Team. Remote work is possible.

Opportunity

Backtracks helps audio content creators and brands know and grow their audience and revenue. You will be responsible for building the Python-side of our web applications, platform, and APIs to deliver delightful experiences to our users and fellow developers.

Your day-to-day...

  • Design an implement services and solutions in Python
  • Code and deploy new features in collaboration with our product and engineering teams
  • Be part of a small team, with a large amount of ownership and responsibility for managing things directly
  • Ship high-quality solutions with a sense of urgency and speed
  • Work closely with both internal and external stakeholders, owning a large part of the process from problem understanding to shipping the solution.
  • Have the freedom to suggest and drive initiatives

We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to simple and elegantly Pythonic code.

You have...

  • History of autonomous design decision making at technically focused companies
  • History of designing and building web components, products, and technology
  • Experience working on design and development in any of the following roles:
    • Python Developer
    • Python Engineer
    • Full Stack Developer
    • Full Stack Engineer
    • Product Developer
    • Product Engineer
    • Software Architect
    • BDFL
  • In-depth understanding of the entire development process (design, development and deployment)
  • Strong knowledge of:
    • Python 3.6+
    • Distributed systems design and implementation
    • Messaging systems and technologies (e.g. RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc.)
    • Docker, Kubernetes
  • Confidence or experience working with:
    • Flask, Sanic, Apache Mod WSGI
    • PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras
    • Spark, Flink
    • Jinja2, HTML, CSS, JavaScript
    • SQLAlchemy
    • Celery
    • Solr, Elasticsearch, or Lucence
    • AWS, Google Cloud, Azure
    • CI/CD deployment processes
  • Motivation and an enjoyment for a startup environment
  • Systematic thinker (consider how components can scale across our platform and product offerings)

items.content:
Backtracks

 

Senior Python Developer


Build delightful software for podcasts and spoken word audio. Backtracks is seeking a qualified Senior Python Developer with some PEP to join our Product & Engineering Team. Remote work is possible.

Opportunity

Backtracks helps audio content creators and brands know and grow their audience and revenue. You will be responsible for building the Python-side of our web applications, platform, and APIs to deliver delightful experiences to our users and fellow developers.

Your day-to-day...


* Design an implement services and solutions in Python

* Code and deploy new features in collaboration with our product and engineering teams

* Be part of a small team, with a large amount of ownership and responsibility for managing things directly

* Ship high-quality solutions with a sense of urgency and speed

* Work closely with both internal and external stakeholders, owning a large part of the process from problem understanding to shipping the solution.

* Have the freedom to suggest and drive initiatives




We expect you to be a tech-savvy professional, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to simple and elegantly Pythonic code.

You have...


* History of autonomous design decision making at technically focused companies

* History of designing and building web components, products, and technology

* Experience working on design and development in any of the following roles:


* Python Developer

* Python Engineer

* Full Stack Developer

* Full Stack Engineer

* Product Developer

* Product Engineer

* Software Architect

* BDFL





* In-depth understanding of the entire development process (design, development and deployment)

* Strong knowledge of:


* Python 3.6+

* Distributed systems design and implementation

* Messaging systems and technologies (e.g. RabbitMQ, Kafka, etc.)

* Docker, Kubernetes





* Confidence or experience working with:


* Flask, Sanic, Apache Mod WSGI

* PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras

* Spark, Flink

* Jinja2, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

* SQLAlchemy

* Celery

* Solr, Elasticsearch, or Lucence

* AWS, Google Cloud, Azure





* CI/CD deployment processes





* Motivation and an enjoyment for a startup environment

* Systematic thinker (consider how components can scale across our platform and product offerings)

* The ability to code and build out designs independently

* A blend of product, system, and people knowledge that lets you jump into a fast paced environment and contribute from day one

* An ability to balance a sense of urgency with shipping high quality and pragmatic solutions

* Strong work sense of ownership

* Strong collaboration and communication skills (fluency in English)

* PMA (Positive Mental Attitude)

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or relevant field and/or relevant work experience

* 5+ years professional experience




Other qualities and traits...


* Passion for podcasts, radio, and spoken word audio

* Passion for delivering high-quality software with quick turnaround times (e.g. you ship)

* A product-first approach to building software

* An enthusiasm for hard problems

* Thrives in a fast-paced environment




Bonus points if you have experience with...


* Building Python-based REST APIs

* Apache AirFlow

* Jenkins or CircleCI for CI/CD

* Audio analysis and processing

Python Back-end web developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Software Development, Technology Staffing, Web Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Soshace | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+03:00) Moscow+00 - Moscow +/- 12 hours

Technologies

python
django
web-development-server
sql
linux
Alina Manager at Soshace 1 1
Andrey Medvedev 391 2 5
Sergei Sheludchenko Senior Front End Developer 16 3
Devishnya 1 1

Job description

  • Are you looking for a remote work on international projects?
  • Are you looking for 40 hours a week workload?
  • Is it suitable for you to use time tracker at work?
  • Is your current qualification level Middle or Senior?

Soshace is an online platform that will provide you with remote work with hourly payment on modern projects lasting on average 6-9 months and more. We are looking for a long-term partnership so when the first project ends we’ll find you a second one and after that the third and so on.

We expect you to work on our projects 8 hours a day Monday-Friday in your time zone.

  • Do you have more than 3-year commercial experience in web development on projects with Python?
  • Do you have 1-year experience in commercial projects with Django?
  • Can you provide a portfolio of relevant projects?
  • Do you have experience in building web applications architecture, experience with databases?
  • Do you have good writing and speaking skills in English (Upper-Intermediate and above)?

If you answer “yes” to all questions, send us your CV and be ready to provide a portfolio of projects you took part in.

The hourly rate we offer depends on your qualification level and geography:

  • Middle $20-$30 an hour
  • Senior $30-$50 an hour.

We have the next stages of the interview:

  1. Primary interview (a detailed discussion of your resume and portfolio)
  2. Online test 
  3. Interview with a technical specialist
Apply now

About Soshace

Soshace is a community of professionals. Since 2015 we’ve made different projects with clients all over the world.
Our clients are companies from the USA, The UK, Australia, Canada and Europe.

We are looking for a broad range of freelancers that are professionals in web development!

We have a large pool of job offers (from our clients) including job offers with relocation opportunities.
We also offer remote work with hourly pay on exciting projects lasting 3 months and more.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote work
  • Flexible schedule
  • International projects
  • Team work
  • Modern technology stack
  • Different projects
  • Long-term partnership

items.content:
ReCharge Payments

 

Software Engineer API


Overview


With over 10,000 online merchants launching subscriptions and over 1,000,000 subscribers powered by ReCharge we're processing tens of millions of dollars in sales every week. Our mission ‘making repeat orders easier for everyone' began four years ago as a bootstrapped startup and today we're at the forefront of recurring billing software with over 100 remote-first employees around the globe.

We're looking for a Software Engineer to join the API team and collaborate on a critical part of the platform. Our API team provides the foundation for which Recharge is powered by and is responsible for creating a single interface into all of Recharge's data.

Our stack includes: Python, Flask, Jinja, ES6, Vue.js, Sass, Webpack, Redis, Docker, GCP, Terraform, Ansible, Memcached, Nginx, Snowflake, Looker, Matillion

What You’ll Do


* Live by and champion our values: #ownership, #empathy, #simple-solutions.

* Write code focused on scalability, testability, supportability and maintainability.

* Implement new technologies to solve ReCharge’s technical challenges as they arise.

* Champion good habits (development techniques, security, tech debt balance, TDD, and agile habits) within your team; improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes.

* Debug production issues across multiple levels of the stack.

* Find and address performance issues throughout the application.

* Perform thorough code reviews and troubleshoot complex issues.

* Work with engineering and product managers to understand roadmap priorities.




What You’ll Bring


* Typically, 4+ years of relevant development experience in fast paced environments

* Knowledge of one of the following languages: Python, Nodejs, Ruby

* Proficient with Python (or willing to learn and can demonstrate ability to learn languages quickly)

* Ability to design and implement RESTful APIs

* Experience with Cloud Platforms such as GCP, AWS, or Azure

* Experience with Docker, auto-scaling, serverless infrastructure

* A knack for engineering simple solutions to solve complex problems

* Self driven; a passion for taking ownership of your work and delivering outcomes

* Ability to work remotely and desire to make an impact at a boot-strapped start-up

* Excellent communication skills, a team player with a ‘winning as a team’ attitude

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience desired





ReCharge Payments is an equal opportunity employer. In addition to EEO being the law, it is a policy that is fully consistent with our principles. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to status as a protected veteran or a qualified individual with a disability, or other protected status such as race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, pregnancy or age. ReCharge Payments prohibits any form of workplace harassment.
